sentences.chinese: 他慢吞吞地跟在我後面走。

sentences.english: Everything was so slow, so clean and so empty.
sentences.chinese: 一切都慢慢吞吞，如此乾淨和空蕩。

sentences.english: The cons continue their slow rebuild of the guards’ room.
sentences.chinese: PI工作隊仍在慢吞吞地重建警衛室。

sentences.english: Impatient with people who are always pokey about getting things done.
sentences.chinese: 我對於做事慢吞吞的人感到很不耐煩。

sentences.english: The old woman was so weak that she could just drag about.
sentences.chinese: 這老婦人身體很弱，只能慢吞吞地走動。

sentences.english: "There are no guarantees, " Doctor Dubois said slowly.
sentences.chinese: “沒有這種保障，”杜波伊斯大夫慢吞吞地說道。

sentences.english: He drawled a greeting to her.
sentences.chinese: 他慢吞吞地對她說聲問候。

sentences.english: In the coal shaft the working-men pushed the coal cars sullenly.
sentences.chinese: 工人們在煤礦裏慢吞吞地推着煤車。

sentences.english: Don't dawdle over your makeup, we don't want to be late for the concert.
sentences.chinese: 你別慢吞吞地化妝，我們不想音樂會遲到。

sentences.english: The old man shuffled slowly into the restaurant.
sentences.chinese: 一個老人拖着腳慢慢吞吞地走進餐館。

sentences.english: The old man shuffled1 slowly into the restaurant.
sentences.chinese: 一位老人慢吞吞地走進了那家餐廳。

sentences.english: He is slow in speaking and cannot communicate with other people very well.
sentences.chinese: 他說話慢慢吞吞，與人交流能力比較差。

sentences.english: The boy dallied over his food.
sentences.chinese: 那男孩慢吞吞地喫東西。

sentences.english: Harry got slowly out of bed and started looking for socks.
sentences.chinese: 哈利慢慢吞吞地從牀上爬起來，開始找襪子。

sentences.english: I get very impatient with people who are always pokey about getting things done.
sentences.chinese: 我對於做事總是慢吞吞的人感到很不耐煩。

sentences.english: She speaks with a Southern drawl.
sentences.chinese: 它慢吞吞的，一步步的走上坡來。

definition: calm and unhurried (idiom); composed/to take matters calmly
neither too fast nor too slow (idiom)
with one's hands clasped behind one's back
as if nothing had happened (idiom); calmly/nonchalantly
to be calm and unruffled in the midst of chaos or at a busy time (idiom)
